render.tex: \title{Injective, Surjective \& Bijective} Types of functions. Easy concepts, difficult names

reason.tex:
%text The figure below shows the various types of functions you need to know about \includegraphics[scale=0.33]{142-A.svg} % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{Nlll}
\hline & \text{Name} & \text{Type} & \text{Bear in mind} \\ \hline A & & \text{Regular} & \text{Two $x$ can map to} \\ & & & \text{the same $y$ but one $x$} \\ & & & \text{cannot map to two $y$} \\ \hline B & \text{Injective} & \text{1-to-1} & \text{$f(x) = f(y) \implies x = y$} \\ & & & \text{$f(x)\neq f(y)\implies x \neq y$} \\ \hline C & \text{Surjective} & \text{Onto} & \text{Every $y$ in co-domain is} \\ & & & \text{mapped to some $x$ in domain} \\ \hline D & \text{Bijective} & \text{Invertible} & \text{Injective $+$ Surjective} \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text %
